fields.description:
When launching EBS-backed instances using the -n option, instances never go into running state.  Instances go from pending to stopped.

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-run-instances -k admin -n 5 emi-9FD643C8
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION     r-E29045C2      345590850920    default
INSTANCE        i-26913FD6      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    pending admin   2               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:27.988Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-28633D13      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    pending admin   4               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:28.076Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-383642B9      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    pending admin   0               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:27.903Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-8DC5449B      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    pending admin   3               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:28.033Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-BDFF43CC      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    pending admin   1               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:27.952Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
{code}

After some time, instances go into stopped state:

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION     r-E29045C2      345590850920    default
INSTANCE        i-26913FD6      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    stopped admin   2               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:27.988Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-28633D13      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    stopped admin   4               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:28.076Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-383642B9      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    stopped admin   0               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:27.903Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-8DC5449B      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    stopped admin   3               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:28.033Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
INSTANCE        i-BDFF43CC      emi-9FD643C8    euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    stopped admin   1               m1.small        2012-07-09T05:05:27.952Z        enter-the-wu        monitoring-disabled     euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com        euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.internal    ebs
{code}
fields.environment: HA environment (CLC, Walrus, CC), SC is using tgtd.

comments.body:
Hi,

So we are interested in pursuing the tgtadm issue reported on July 9th :


        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)
Mon Jul 9 08:38:13 2012 ERROR [SystemUtil:pool-25-thread-4] [edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.util.SystemUtil.run(SystemUtil.java):95] 

com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: tgtadm: can't find the target

Does the configuration include a real iSCSI storage node , or 
a local store craved up as iSCSI block devices ?

The error sequence in the log here is misleading  :

2012 ERROR [SystemUtil:pool-25-thread-4] [edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.util.SystemUtil.run(SystemUtil.java):95] com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: tgtadm: can't find the target

        at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.util.SystemUtil.run(SystemUtil.java:91)
        at com.eucalyptus.storage.ISCSIManager.allocateTarget(ISCSI

allocatetarget() is using tdtadm cli to determine if a iSCSI tid target exists before it is created, so this message always appears when launching an instance. 

Can I get error log entries after this entry ?

I have seen failures of launching multiple ebs images when the  /disk1/storage
exceeds the limits defined by maxtotalvolumesizeingb    :


 euca-describe-properties | grep volumesizeingb
PROPERTY        PARTI00.storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb  100
PROPERTY        PARTI00.storage.maxvolumesizeingb       15

A long entry appears:

 CreateStorageVolumeType to service StorageInternal because: Total Volume Size Limit Exceeded volume: vol-239A3E47

  This error indicates maxtotalvolumesizeingb  quota has been exceeded.

I am able to launch instances repeatingly  on a single clc+nc0 setup running centos 6.2 .  

I am stuck at recreating the issue. The logs provided don't indicate to me any failures.
The "tgtadm target not found" is a misleading message that is not part any failure.
I am unable to duplicate this behaviour.

Harold, there are some challenges around reproducing this.  Can you sync with John and see what we may be able to uncover about what made this so much easier for us to reproduce.

Thanks,

Darren

Hey [~jdonnelly],

Apologies for the late follow-up.  Do you still need help reproducing this issue?  Please let me know so that we can work on reproducing this issue.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Sure.Do you have  HA setup ready ? 

We have a couple of recent ebs fixes in 3.2;

I ran a loop ebs test on a 2 node HA setup running nightly 3.3 build 
until it failed .( approx 12 hours ) . The test launched 14 ebs at once 
( the maximum described by euca-describe-available-zones ). 

{noformat}

./loopebs.sh -e emi-5C9444A8 -B -n -s2 5



Tue Feb 26 02:34:58 PST 2013; Runs: 566, , Instances: 14
Tue Feb 26 02:36:02 PST 2013; small: 0014, med: 0006
2, RunInstancesType: Not enough resources: Cannot run EBS instances in partition w/o a storage controller: Failed to lookup ENABLED service of type Storage in partition Partition:name=PARTI00:cc-cert-serial=24001409663803:nc-cert-serial=24013008028846  Service is currently ENABLING. 

{noformat}


The error is related to tgtd not responding:


{noformat}

cloud-debug.log:Tue Feb 26 02:43:41 2013 ERROR [ISCSIManager:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#11] [com.eucalyptus.storage.ISCSIManager.execute(ISCSIManager.java):201] //usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap service tgtd status  timed out. Cancelling the process, logging a fault and exceptioning out
cloud-debug.log:Tue Feb 26 02:43:48 2013 ERROR [Component:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#11] [com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.doTransition(Component.java):613] java.lang.RuntimeException: No response from the command //usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap service tgtd status . Process timed out after waiting for 10000 milliseconds


{noformat}
Launching ebs images have greatly improved in 3.2.1 ; Euca still encounters transient system resource issues ( like tgtd failing to respond ) that may impact uptime.

Hey [~jdonnelly],

Thanks for testing this.  Based upon this testing, if a customer is using tgtd for the SC, should we do the following:

* inform them that tgtd will be slower with regards to performance
* discuss how the enter-the-wu.storage.timeoutinmillis cloud property could be used to ensure that the EBS-backed instances will launch - even though it may take some time.
* discuss how to use IAM policies to put a quota on the number of EBS-backed instances a user can run - to help throttle usage.

Thoughts?

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
Harold recommended looking the tgtd timeouts

I increased storage.timeoutinmillis  from 10 seconds to 60 and it has greatly 
improved the loopesb.sh run by 200 % ; I have ran almost 90 "run-instances -n 14 " - that is over 1200 launches .

We should increase the 10 second timeout to something more accommodating for larger systems.

The timer function of 10 secs was introduced in:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-3597

Consensus action is to document this behaviour and work around.
 

 I suggestion adding this to Administrator Guide under 
 "Debugging Walrus and Storage" 

 http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.2/ag/ts_walrus.html#ts_walrus

[~jdonnelly], can you provide some content that we can use for the Docs?  Especially regarding the workaround?  

Thanks.

[~hspencer], this has now been documented in the 3.2.2 docs in DOC-755.  From the comments in the bug my understanding is that we're ok closing this out with the appropriate documentation.  Any objections to closing this bug now?
This was "fixed" via documentation.  See the related Doc ticket for details on the workaround.

worklogs.comment: Launching ebs images have greatly improved in 3.2.1 ; Euca still encounters transient system resource issues ( like tgtd failing to respond ) that may impact uptime.
